Name: World War 1 Wargames Rules
Description:
Tabletop minatures wargames rules.

Scales:
1mm : 1 yard
1 turn : 1 minute

Variable figure scales according to size of figures/vehicles used:
6mm figures : 1 figure = 1 man
15mm figures : 1 figure = 10 man
25mm figures : 1 figure = 25 man

Units of 100 men/50 cavalry/4-6 vehicles or guns

Overall battle scale is approximately brigade (multiple battalions)

Name: Isabel y Diego
Description:
The legend of the lovers of Teruel has multiple literary and theatrical versions, as well as a reflection in other artistic manifestations. It is a story about an impossible and chaste love with a tragic ending, possibly originating in the 15th century but whose plot is set in the 13th century, starring the lady Isabel de Segura and the gentleman Juan Martínez de Marcilla (better known as Diego from the theatrical performances of the seventeenth century). Today it is an unavoidable part of the culture of Teruel.

With Isabel y Diego, will you be able to change the legend?
In this game 3 to 7 players are divided into two teams. 
The first team will be friends of Isabel and Diego who want to change the disastrous ending of the legend and get the couple to reunite and grow old together. To do this, they will help Diego to achieve the necessary wealth to marry her to Isabel, and will prevent her from giving in to the pressure she receives from her to marry Don Rodrigo de Azagra.
The other team will be enemies of the couple who will try by all means that Diego falls in combat and that Isabel collapses and agrees to marry the Lord of Albarracín.

Isabel y Diego is a strategy game in which you have to coordinate with your team to achieve your objectives while trying to disrupt those of the opponents. 
Play cunning, decide wisely how to use the cards in your hands, and lead your team to victory.

Name: Character Pack 4: Hired Hands & Helping Henchmen – A Character Expansion for Five Leagues from the Borderlands
Description:
Character Pack 4 for Five Leagues deviates a bit from the standard by offering a new game mechanic: Hired hands.

With these rules you can hire on helpers such as a blacksmith, torchbearer or 6 other types. Their purpose is to assist your war band off the field (and occasionally on it), allowing you to form a support staff.

You can even attempt to push them into battle in an emergency, but they're likely to demand more pay or even leave on the spot.

This pack can be added to any campaign, even if using alternate warbands such as the Dwarf warband. It can be added to an on-going campaign with no issue.
Families: Series: Five Leagues From the Borderland

Name: CHOAM
Description:
A free PnP asymmetrical Monopoly game inspired by the classic Dune board game.

Unlike traditional Monopoly, players can choose between five different factions, each with unique abilities and win conditions. Each player will have four fighters they can use to attack others and lay claim to the enemy's strongholds but it will always be at a cost.

Players should also be careful of the very planet itself, as Arrakis is a harsh place and to survive it will take its toll. Luckily, if a player owns certain territories they either gain by force or are naturally given it from the start, they can receive riches in the form of the spice melange.

With the spice, players can bribe and trade with each other and afford to survive in the hostile deserts of Arrakis. But players should be cautious, as deals can be broken and players can lie their way to getting spice. Calling them out on not following through on a deal or catching them in a lie can cause them to lose a turn but a player falsely accusing someone of lying can have harsher consequences.

The game ends when any of the unique faction specific winning conditions are met.

Name: Villagers: Dice Tower Promo Cards
Description:
Six cards for Villagers:

Hayer, Lumberjack, Miner, Vasel, Healey, Garcia.

Description:
A new set of 6 tiles for Smartphone, originally offered in The Dice Tower 2020 Kickstarter Campaign. Included are starting improvements with permanent bonus.

+ 1 to Logistics during phase 6

-1 to price during phase 2 and +1 item of goods during phase 3

+ 1 to price during phase 2

Place 1 (steps icon) in 2 different technologies
Place 1 (building icon) in "S" region
Place 1 (steps icon) in 1 region and 1 technology

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Builders Pack.

Name: Catacombs (Third Edition): Goblin Mage Expansion
Description:
The Goblin Mage is a new Catacomb Lord for Catacombs (Third Edition) that has the ability to summon clones of himself. Choose which clone (blue, purple, or green) is placed during the setup phase.

Features two variations of the Stromm Catacomb Lord, with the second version intended for more experienced players. There is also a monster version corresponding room card where he is featured.

The summon Stromm shot is like a normal summon shot except it allows the overseer to summon up to two additional clones. All clones in play share Stromm's collective pool of remaining health points.

Each clone takes his own turn, performing one of the shot sequences listed on the rules card.

When damaged is inflicted on a clone, the piece is returned to the Overseer and Stromm's health track is reduced by the amount of damage inflicted. A minimum of one clone must remain in play.

Clones may be summoned repeatedly during the battle phase. Once Stromm's health track is reduced to 0, all his clones are defeated.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Builders Pack.

Name: Banco Inmobiliario: Montevideo
Description:
Banco Inmobiliario: Montevideo is a monopoly-like board game where the goal is to become the richest player by buying, selling or renting properties in the capital city of Uruguay.

Contains: 24 houses, 10 hotels, 2 dice, 6 pawns, instructions 1 board, 1 set of tickets, 24 titles of Property 1 set of "Luck" / "Destiny" cards.

Name: Þingspilið: Með þingmenn í vasanum
Description:
In the Þingspilið (The Congress Game) card game players compete to get the most congressmen as possible. Players draw party leaders and start with 5 congressmen. Then they resolve issues, events and scandals (in a last in, first out order) to gain more congressmen. Wheeling and dealing is very much encouraged in this game.

—user summary

Name: شمشیر سامورایی + آفتاب تابان (Samurai Sword)
Description:
Samurai Sword is a game based on the proven Bang! mechanisms and set in feudal Japan. In this game, the familiar features of Bang! are enhanced by more dynamic and fast-paced game play, and thanks to a new scoring system – based on honor points and resilience points – there is no player elimination. Everybody gets to fight to the very end! Also, weapons and attacks are fused into a single card.

—description from the publisher

This edition contains the Rising Sun expansion.

Name: Gioca Livorno
Description:
Gioca Livorno 
The aim of the game, inspired by the history of Livorno, is to become the master of the city (sindaco, padrone, capo della città) by acquiring powers along the board.

Gioca Livorno includes:

     objective cards with winning conditions
     a board that covers all the districts of the city with their historical shields. They are arranged as in the Palio Marinaro: Ovosodo, Borgo Cappuccini, Colline-Coteto, Venice, Antignano, Fabbricotti, Shanghai, Ardenza, Magenta / Origine, Quercianella, Pontino San Marco, Montenero, Salviano, Stazione, Sorgenti, San Jacopo
     25 cards Laws of Livorno, about the history of the city
     pawns
     dice
     Talleri the game currency

Name: Noch mal!: Zusatzblockset
Description: Noch mal! Zusatzblockset is a set of three new booklets (I, II, III) with new sheets for use with the Noch mal! dice game. The new arrangements of colors provide a new game experience.

Name: Borneo
Description: This is a board game version of Borneo.

Name: 曇天／斬合 Tactics (Donten no Kiriai Tactics)
Description:
æ›‡å¤©ï¼æ–¬åˆ Tactics (ã©ã‚“ã¦ã‚“ã®ãã‚Šã‚ã„ Tactics) Donten no Kiriai Tactics is a Japanese game for two players. It is a simpler game than the original æ›‡å¤©ï¼æ–¬åˆ Legend (Donten no Kiriai Legend) to let players learn the basic game before progressing to the full edition. The designer includes solitaire rules.

Two Samurais duel, using basic movement and attack cards.

Measure the distance with your opponent and decide on a blow! As a samurai, all you can do is change your stance, advance or retreat, and slash. The duel continues hot and fast, round after round, until one of the Samurai succumbs to their wounds.

The players take a basic deck of six cards. Players set up the duelling positions, with the Samurai initially being two steps apart, and then each secretly chooses a hand card face-down. When they are ready, the cards are turned up.

The basic cards involve the Samurai advancing or retreating, and adopting different stances. If the Samurai move close enough together, and onto the same spot, then a strike can happen.

Basic attacks can be made repeatedly, the card goes back to the player's hand when used.

A round ends when a successful strike is made, and damage is shown on the attacking card. The player struck loses hit points.

The first player to lose all their health loses the duel.
user summary

Name: The Eternal City (fan expansion for Charterstone)
Description:
This is a fan-made expansion to Charterstone designed to be used after the campaign has been completed. It is highly recommended that you do not use this material until after you have completed the campaign!

—description from the designer

Name: Agitation und Propaganda
Description:
Agitation and Propaganda (short: agitprop) is a strategic Card game that deals with the history of left-wing groups and movements in Germany.
The game tells the story of the developments and conflicts of the left movement from 1945 until today. The groups and actors are characterized enough to have enough potential for hostility, know-it-all and of course to give divisions.
The aim of the game is to create a network of allied left-wing groups to cope with the social challenges in the course of mercilessly advancing history.
With the successful unlocking of history cards and the achieving of special organizational goals, the players collect revolution points. These are used to get to the top of the Revolution by the end and win the game!

Name: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: Big Box
Description:
Both the original The Quacks of Quedlinburg, and The Herb Witches expansion, all packaged up in one big box bundle! Also thrown in for good measure is the mini-expansion, Wolfgang’s Exchange Office.

In The Quacks of Quedlinburg, players are charlatans — or quack doctors — each making their own secret brew by adding ingredients one at a time. Take care with what you add, though, for a pinch too much of this or that will spoil the whole mixture!

Each player has their own bag of ingredient chips. During each round, they simultaneously draw chips and add them to their pot. The higher the face value of the drawn chip, the further it is placed in the swirling pattern, increasing how much your potion is worth. Push your luck as far as you can, but if you add too many cherry bombs, your pot explodes!

At the end of each round, players gain victory points and coins to spend on new ingredients to add to their bags, depending on the strength of the ingredients in their pots. But players with exploded pots must choose points or coins — not both! The player with the most victory points at the end of nine rounds wins the game.

Included in this box are:


     The Quacks of Quedlinburg: the base game
     The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Herb Witches: the first expansion, adding Witches that grant powers once per game as well as more ingredient books.
     The Quacks of Quedlinburg: Wolfgang's Exchange Office: a mini-expansion adding new conditions for end-game scoring.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Victory at Sea: Gneisenau
Description:
While serving as commerce raiders, the Scharnhorst-class Battleships (or battlecruisers), Scharnhorst and Gneisenau were responsible for sinking over 105,000 tons of allied shipping in a single cruise.

The two ships operated together for much of the early portion of the war, including sorties into the Atlantic, the sinking of British cruiser HMS Rawalpindi and Operation Weserübung, the German invasion of Norway. In these operations off Norway, Gneisenau along with Scharnhorst, engaged and sank the aircraft carrier HMS Glorious, but in turn Gneisenau was damaged in action against HMS Renown and was subsequently struck by torpedoes.

After further actions in the Atlantic in 1941, the two ships put in at Brest, and were subject to repeated Allied bombing raids. Despite suffering damage, Gneisenau was repaired in good time and in early 1942, the two battle cruisers participated in a daylight dash up the English Channel, sailing for Germany. Gneisenau reached Kiel in early February and went into drydock. On the night of 26 February, the British launched an air attack on the ship, with an explosion in the forward ammunition section causing such heavy damage that it was deemed that the ship's weapons would be refit (as had been originally planned), necessitating a rebuild for her to accommodate larger 38cm guns (her original 28 cm became shore batteries). These plans were abandoned on Hitler's order in 1943. 
On 27 March 1945, Gneisenau was sunk as a block-ship in German occupied Poland. Eventually, she was broken up for scrap in 1951.

—description from the publisher

Name: Victory at Sea: Graf Zeppelin
Description:
Though laid down and launched before the start of the war, the Graf Zeppelin was never completed or commissioned, and it never saw action.

Whilst four aircraft of the class had originally been planned, constant in-fighting between the Kriegsmarine and Luftwaffe, as well as a priority on the building of U-Boats hampered their construction, with the planned four carriers quickly reduced to two. Construction on the ship that would eventually be christened Graf Zeppelin was eventually halted in 1940.

However, with the role of the carrier proving itself in the Battle of Taranto, in the sinking of the Bismarck and at Pearl Harbour and Midway prompted construction to briefly continue. The Graf Zeppelin was almost completed in 1943 but Hitler, disappointed with the Kriegsmarine, halted all surface fleet construction. The Carrier was captured by the Soviet Union at the end of the war, and was sunk as a target ship in 1947.

Though obviously never seeing action in reality, Kriegsmarine players are afforded new tactical options in Victory at Sea with the opportunity to include this carrier in their fleet.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Red Skies: US Ace Pilot – Boots Blesse
Description:
Frederick Corbin "Boots" Blesse (August 22, 1921 – October 31, 2012) was a United States Air Force major general and flying ace. Graduating from the United States Military Academy in 1945, he subsequently flew two combat tours during the Korean War, completing 67 missions in P-51s, 35 missions in F-80s and 121 missions in F-86s.

For the first tour he was assigned to Fighter-Bomber Squadrons. The latter tour, in which he piloted the F-86, is where he was officially credited with shooting down nine MiG-15s and one La-9. This earned him the accolade, at the time of the conclusion of his tour, in 1952, of being America's top jet ace.

During the second tour in F-86s, as part of the 334th Fighter-Interceptor squadron he was officially credited with shooting down nine MiG-15s and one La-9, as well as (unofficially) an additional probable kill, and three more enemy aircraft damaged. At the time of his return to the United States in October 1952, he was America's leading jet ace.

Contains 1 Resin Lockheed F-80C Shooting Star Aircraft and game cards.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Blood Red Skies – Korean War

Name: Blood Red Skies: US Ace Pilot – Royce Williams
Description:
On 18 November 1952, piloting a Grumman Panther, Lt Royce Williams of VF-781 destroyed four MiGs in a single encounter that lasted no more than 35 minutes. During a series of air strikes against the North Korean port of Hoeryong, the four MiGs were intercepted as a result of intelligence provided by the US National Security Agency. Williams lost contact with his wingman and found himself in a 6-on-1 confrontation against the fearsome MiG 15. Nevertheless, he downed four of the enemy jets and upon returning to the USS Oriskany, his Panther was found to have sustained 263 hits from cannon shells and was beyond repair.

What makes this feat all the more remarkable is that the four MiGs downed were confirmed to have been flown by Soviet Naval Aviation Pilots. This was only confirmed by Russian sources 40 years later - with all Soviet involvement vehemently denied, during and for many years after, the Korean War.

Contains 1 Resin Grumman F9F Panther and game cards.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Blood Red Skies – Korean War

Name: On the Underground: Street Fair
Description:
Setup: Before setting up the game, randomly draw 3 Destination cards, and place a Street Fair tile in each of the stations they show. Shuffle those cards back in the deck.

Gameplay: When placing Track tokens, a player scores 2 points whenever they connect a station with a Street Fair tile with the Passenger start station using the same line.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Builders Pack.

Name: Battle Royale: Flick to the Death – Lone Wolf Promo Cards
Description:
With this promo, you can add a 6th player to the game.

Setup: Shuffle the Lone Wolf character card with the other characters. A player may choose to play as the Lone Wolf instead of a normal 4 character team.

Shuffle the weapon card into the loot deck.

Lone Wolf's ability has 3 effects:
- May perform an extra move or attack action each turn.
- Is always considered to have a Melee weapon and may choose to use it instead of a weapon he has equipped.
- Starts with armor. Draw an armor icon on his card at the beginning of the game.

Lone Wolf Legendary Weapon:
The character wielding this may attack in either of 2 ways:
- Make a single short ranged attack
- Give up their move action to use their attack action to make 3 short ranged attacks.
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

Note: This card was delivered in 2020 while the base game is scheduled for 2021.

Name: Joking Hazard: PAX 2019 Exclusive card
Description: A single promo card distributed at PAX East 2019 which reads, "We'll see what the rulebook says about this!"

Name: Diletto: Secret of Eden
Description:
One day, an angel gave you two rings, one silver and one gold. Upon reading the inscription, a horned man in a tailcoat appeared. "I will grant any wish you ask, but will take the soul of the bearer of the silver ring in compensation"

You cleverly place the silver ring on a stone statue that has a soul that eternally replenishes itself. With this, you can have any wish granted without losing anything! Or so you thought...

Your goal as a player is to be just a bit greedy, to be happier than everyone else by getting the Devil to fulfill more of your wishes. He will grant any wish you have, and the statue will provide the soul in payment. But sometimes mischievous stuffed animals will steal the soul and the price will not have be paid.

Initially, the Devil will forgive you with just a warning, but if payments are late too often, horrible things will happen to the last player to make a wish. Sometimes you will need to be bold and other times you will need to be more modest, in order to have the most wishes granted, but not have made the last wish when the Devil's patience runs out.

Diletto: Secret of Eden is a card game for two to five players, in which you will take turns having a wish granted. The larger the wish, the more of your soul that must be given in compensation. Draw an appropriate number of cards from the ring deck, and if you draw an 'oops', place it in play. Once three 'oops' are accumulated, the wish fails and the players receive a warning. Players accumulate 'sense' during the course of the game, which can be used to reduce the risk of a wish by reducing how many ring cards to draw.

When the final warning appears, the Devil will take the soul of the next player to fail a wish, causing them to instantly lose and the game ends. The winner is the remaining player with the most wishes granted.

Diletto shares characters and story with Domina Games' previous game Eresia.

Name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Heritage: The Gentleman's Story
Description:
Designed by a true connoisseur of Vampire: The Masquerade, this mostly mission-based add-on follows the story of one Roger de Camden from the early 1300s to the mid-twentieth century.

The Gentleman's Story

This expansion adds a suite of infamous kindred to your copy of Vampire: The Masquerade - Heritage. Roger de Camden, otherwise known as "The Gentleman", provides letters of introduction to mysterious figures shaping the World of Darkness. Call upon their favor to alter your chronicle, twisting bloodlines and banishing troublesome characters to the shadows... or bringing them back.

This expansion features 28 cards to be added to the chronicle deck after the first chapter and revealed through play. Use the card ID (bottom right corner) to place them in the right order. The Gentleman's Story expansion introduces 2 new card types to the game.

Includes:
1 - Rule Card
4 - Strays
24 - Letters of Introduction

THE STRAYS
These 4 new and exclusive characters are implemented the same way as chronicle characters. The Victor of that chapter sleeves the new character with either side visible, and retains or adds them to the character deck. Strays include: Mahtiel, Abdalkutba, Pentweret, & Roger De Camden.

LETTERS OF INTRODUCTION
These 24 cards each conclude a specific mission chain. The player who has claimed the most corresponding missions receives the letter of introduction, which may be discard during any aftermath phase for the indicated effect. In the case of ties, no player receives the letter of introduction.

Retain - Instead of selecting a retainer from your bloodline, select any vampire of the indicated clan (including from an opponent's bloodline or the character deck).
Banish - Select any vampire of the indicated clan, and place them into this expansion box. They may not be used for the rest of the chronicle.
Readmit - Return any previously banished vampire into play, moving them from this expansion box to the character deck.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Gra w Wojnę
Description: A game of War illustrated by Andrzej Mleczko. Rules for Kuku and 3-5-8 are inluded in the box.

Name: Gra w Pana
Description: A game of Pan illustrated by Andrzej Mleczko. Rules for Oszust and Makao are inluded in the box.

Name: Dupa biskupa
Description:
The party game known as Dupa biskupa can be played with any set of cards and any number of players, over any number of rounds. There is one general rule; the more players there are, the more cards are required.

The game starts with cards being dealt so that each player receives the same amount. Starting from the first, players lay down cards in such a way that everyone can see the card. Having laid the card, the player has to perform a certain action established before starting the game, and corresponding to the suit and rank of the card. Some suits or ranks require that the player perform no action.

Player who perform the wrong action, or fail to perform one when required, is obliged to take the pile of cards.

The winner of each round attributes a way of acting to other cards in the next round, but the actions for queens, kings and aces remains the same.

The first player to empty their hand wins the game.

Name: Box Quiz: Årsquiz 2020
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Quiz of the year 2020'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about quiz of the year 2020. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

—user summary

Name: Kami Climb!
Description:
ã‚«ãƒŸã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ ! (Kami Climb!) is a dexterity game from Japan, exhibited for the first time at Tokyo Game Market Autumn 2019. Before playing, the paper mountain is constructed by hand using the paper materials supplied. Through paper folding, a large column with angular sides is built, standing in a solid base unit. The shape resembles the artificial climbing walls found in modern sports centres.

Once the piece of paper is transformed into a steep rocky mountain, the players operate their climber with one finger, to aim for the top of the mountain. The player first pushes their climber up with their finger and hooks it on the anchor to proceed. The anchors match the climbers' colours.

There are two phases, plan and climb. Reach the anchors on the 3D board in turn order. When climbing, if the climber reaches an anchor in their colour, they take another move.

Players can win by reaching the summit faster than the others. But a player can still win if they take the harder routes. Players must choose between easier, faster routes, and harder, more technical routes. If a player can conquer the hardest route in three turns, they win.
user summary

Name: 東京Resistance (Tokyo Resistance)
Description:
Setting

Tokyo - 2048

In Japan, which was occupied by Country C by World War III, a puppet government was established by the Co-New Party. On the other hand, the Resistance aiming for independence has started anti-government activities. And in order to crack down on this and destroy it, the Ministry of Interior has organized a special armored unit, commonly known as "special armored unit", for the purpose of maintaining security.

In this way, a fierce battle between the Resistance and the Special Armored Corps was fought in the capital, Tokyo.

Overview

Tokyo Resistance is a game about the struggle between the resistance, who are trying to overthrow the government, and the security forces, who are trying to prevent them from doing so.

The core of the game is card-based action, with each side playing cards to determine who will attack first and who will attack second.
The game is based on card actions, with the first attacker executing the action of the card they played.

The victory condition for the resistance side is to destroy five bases of the security forces.
The victory condition for the Security Forces is to find and eliminate the Resistance leader and his hideout.

The Resistance is outnumbered, but outmobile.
The Security Forces are superior in offensive power and mobility, but they are small in number.

You must lead forces of different nature to achieve victory!
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Instant Words
Description:
Fast paced game of word categories. Players compete to be the first to correctly call out a corresponding word in the current category.

On each game turn, the games master calls out a word category, all participants are to listen and respond as fast as possible with a correct example of the mentioned category.

Before beginning the game, the players agree on required number of cards for a winner to emerge based on how long they want to play for. The game ends once a player attains the predetermined number of cards.

-description from designer

Name: Glen More II: Chronicles – Feed the Kraken Mini Chronicle
Description:
This promo adds 5 cards that feature the famous ship **INSTABIL**. There is also a rules card which explains how you can use these cards together with some Glen More II components to add a little bluffing and deduction — key features of **Feed the Kraken** — to your Glen More II rounds.  These 5 resource cards have no title or card text.

-description from Kickstarter page

Included in both the Basic and Deluxe version of the Feed the Kraken Feed the Kraken game box. There are currently no plans to make these available on their own.

Name: Monopoly: SCP – Sporting Portugal
Description:
If your admiration for Sporting exceeds the limits of the pitch, consider yourself summoned to play this version of Monopoly !

Contains: 1 board, 8 pawns, 28 title cards, 16 place cards, 16 visitor cards, 1 Monopoly money pack, 32 benches, 12 stadiums, 2 dice and 1 quick dice

Name: Trivial Pursuit: SCP – Bite Size
Description:
This bite-size edition of the well-known game TRIVIAL PURSUIT is exclusively dedicated to Sporting Clube de Portugal.

This is the travel edition of the Sporting Clube de Portugal Trivial Pursuit with about 600 questions about the history of this Centenary Club.

Test your knowledge of the Club and its history!

Name: Mountain Goats: Expansion Pack
Description:
Mountain Goats: Expansion Pack adds a 5th player and the Big Mountain expansion to the king of the hill style game.

The Big Mountain expansion offers an additional target for your goat, a big mountain. There is only room for one goat at each step in the path ascending this bigger mountain. However, only a few goats with the greatest ascent will earn points.

Roll your dice and decide whether to compete for king of the hills from the base game or instead commit your goat to the big mountain.  Timing is important on the big mountain.  Goats committed to the big mountain may not even score depending on thier relative position on the big mountain.  The Big Mountain expansion increases the tension and impact the final few rounds.

Additionally, this expansion increases the maximum player count to 5 which can be applied to the base game or the Big Mountain expansion.

This was packaged together along with two other expansion in 10-Minute Games: Expansions, but is now available by itself as well.

Name: Personal Space: The Zoological Moon
Description:
The Zoological Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Zoological Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 3:00-4:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: Wild World Zoo
Local Cuisine: The Beast of Pizza

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

    Dr. Agaz Morravel
    Istra Zo Gluxan
    Jol Varoneth
    Tarra Mothrek

Name: Personal Space: The Theatrical Moon
Description:
The Theatrical Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Theatrical Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 2:00-3:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: Marga's Playhouse
Local Cuisine: To Brie Or Not To Brie

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

    Deniz Bellax
    Dorado Kuston
    Leena Zyzum
    Nadia Chindam

Name: Periodic: A Game of the Elements – Dice Goal Promo Card
Description:
You may include the Dice Goal Card when playing Periodic: A Game of the Elements.

This Goal Card is included as a 5th starting Goal, and is not refilled after it is completed (nor does this trigger the end of the game). Use 15-point Lab Tokens as substitute Goal Markers.

The player who completes this Goal takes this Goal Card (worth 13 points) and may immediately take 3 Energy Tokens from any Periodic Trend(s) on the board. (If fewer than 3 Energy Tokens are available, take as many as are available.) Any other player who had Research Cubes on the Goal Card receives a 3-point Lab Token for each of their Research Cubes on the Goal Card (this is an exception to the typical reward).

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.

Name: Sequoia: Expansion Pack
Description:
Sequoia: Expansion Pack adds a 6th player, partnership variant, and the Negative Value expansion to this dice based area majority style game.

The Negative Value expansion modifies the area scoring for some regions to negative values.  In these cases, those with the least influence in the region lose points as opposed to those with the most in the region earning points.

Additionally, this expansion increases the maximum player count to 6 which can be applied to the base game, partnership variant, or the Negative Value expansion.

The partnership variant pairs players into teams such that their combined influence is measured for area majority and both partners in the most successful team are the winners.

This was packaged together along with two other expansion in 10-Minute Games: Expansions and currently not available by itself.

Name: 10-Minute Games: Expansions
Description:
Up the fun on the three small games by adding the expansion pack which increases player counts and adds special variables.

The Mountain Goat expansion pack adds more components for a fifth player and "The Big Mountain" expansion.

The Sequoia expansion pack adds more components for a sixth player and the "Negative Point Values" expansion.

The GPS expansion pack adds three specialty satellites for each player and components for a sixth and seventh player.

Name: Borders of Blood: Wargaming the Paraguayan War 1864 -1870
Description:
Fronteiras de Sangue / Borders of Blood is a system of wargame rules focused on the greatest war in the history of South America, the War of Paraguay, or War of the Triple Alliance, or, still, Guasú War (Great War).

The confrontation was fought between Paraguay and the Triple Alliance, composed of Brazil, Argentina, and Uruguay, and extended from December 1864 to March 1870.

Features:

     Battalion level rules for 6 to 28mm minis
     Action dice to randomize number of actions that troops can take each turn
     Action card to randomize events each turn
     original combat system
     army list (including generals) for the 4 belligerents
     2 scenarios

Name: Treasure Hunt
Description:
In Treasure Hunt one player plays as the Pirate, while all other players work as a team to control all of the Treasure Hunters in their quest for treasure. Work and play together to move your Hunters around the board. Builds social skills, confidence, empathy, emotional intelligence, and logic skills as you cooperate as a team. If the buried treasure is discovered before the Pirate captures all four Treasure Hunters, the Hunters win! If the Pirate captures all Treasure Hunters the Pirate wins! It's that simple. With a gameplay time of around 10 minutes, you'll want to play again and again. Alright, let's get playing - the hunt is on!

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Mega Édition Beauvais
Description:
Monopoly: Mega Édition Beauvais is bigger and believe it or not, faster than regular Monopoly. 
What makes it bigger is a larger board, Train Depots, Skyscrapers, 9 new Properties. 
It is faster because of a new speed die and Bus cards. 
Monopoly: Mega Édition Beauvais can be played in 1½ hours with more fun than ever!

The massive game board has 12 additional spaces.

Buy all the properties of a group, build your houses and hotels, and then keep on going by building Skyscrapers for a chance to earn mega rents. 
Good news: you can build houses and hotels once you own three out of four properties in a group (or two out of three in the smaller groups). You can even build a Depot on a railroad to double its rent.

Roll three dice on your turn: two regular dice and the special "Speed" Die. The Speed Die gives you a chance for free trip to the next available property. (Later in the game the Speed Die could send you to the next property you owe rent on. Ouch!) From time to time you'll earn free "Bus Tickets." Use them to go where you want to go, but beware: they expire! The Speed Die and the Bus Tickets make the action speedy, intense, and sure-fire fun!

Name: Traversez les Pyrénées à vélo ou en parapente
Description:
Traversez les Pyrénées à vélo ou en parapente , a journey full of pitfalls and challenges!

     2 levels of difficulty, child and adult version
     5 types of games: foldable main board of the Pyrenees chain (90 cm) 
     a small board Look for the differences with the drawing of the game box 
     and on the front Find the Pyrenean flora and fauna ...
     200 thematic cards printed on both sides: 400 questions on fauna, flora, the Pyrenees, Pyrenean specialties, local vocabulary, unforeseen events and challenges
     Family friendly and educational game from 3 to 103 years old, 2 to 6 players or more in teams
     ~90 min if you play the bicycle version (65 stages) 
     ~45 min if you play the paragliding version (45 stages)

Name: Forces of Nature
Description:
Forces of Nature is a simple yet sophisticated card game where 2-4 players must fight to win as the last player standing. Each turn, players draw cards and make tough decisions. Players use the available Will – a growing economy for the round – to bring cards from their hand into the Wild – the gameplay area. Once in the Wild, players command their cards and animals to battle opponents.

Animal, Force, and Nature cards with their own unique abilities may seem simple by themselves, but masterfully combining them can lead to some exceptionally thrilling matches.


     Animals – like the Gorilla – can attack other animals and players in the Wild, and can also be used to defend attacks from opponents.
     Force cards – such as Patience – can make opponents reevaluate their strategy by making permanent changes to animals during the game.
     Nature cards – including Volcano – change the course of the game by directly impacting players and animals in the Wild.


Force of Nature is a special card that can deal a devastating blow to opponents – it removes all animals for all players in the Wild. Used at just the right moment, this card can dramatically turn the tables on unsuspecting players.

The last surviving player wins Forces of Nature.

—description from the designer

Name: Me-MO Island
Description:
A 2-4 player tile laying family game of pitting adorable me-MO against each other. But be careful, all those creatures are just ready to POP!

Setup the island differently each game with obstacles like balloon tiles, healing wells, and giant boulders. Then players draw a hand of 3 Me-MO and take turns placing them onto the island. Activating special abilities and knocking some health off opposing Me-MO as they enter play.

Watch out for Me-MO with low health though, once they POP they'll deal damage to every Me-MO around them, even friendly ones! Causing a chain reaction that could end the game.

First one to POP five of their opponents Me-MO win the game!

With Basic and Advanced rules, the game is suitable for all ages and skill levels. The basic rules focus on spatial awareness and simple math with no reading required, while advanced mode introduces special abilities and more strategic play.

-description from designer

Name: Nidavellir: Thingvellir
Description:
(EN) Thingvellir

Mandated by the King, visit every tavern in the kingdom, hire the most skillful dwarves to save Nidavellir, and rely on Queen Dagfid who has called for help brave mercenaries and their precious artifacts.

Now, the Elvaland can instead of recruiting a Dwarf card or Royal Offering card in the tavern, choose to go to the Camp to take a Magic Artefact or recruit a Mercenary card. In the event of a tie to determine the highest bet on a current tavern, refer to the gem values as in the basic game. Only the Elvaland with the highest bet can go to the Camp and take a card. The other Elvalands must, in order of resolution, take a card from the tavern being resolved. If the Elvaland who played first chooses to take a card from the Camp, the remaining Dwarf card from the tavern must be discarded before proceeding to the next tavern Resolution. The Camp consists of Artifacts and Mercenaries.

Thingvellir, the trumps :

- New Hero cards, Mercenary cards with two classes and Artifact cards with unique powers.
- An innovative coin building system.
- Numerous and varied strategies.

				
				
					(FR) Thingvellir

Mandaté.e par le Roi, sillonnez chaque taverne du royaume, engagez les nain·e·s les plus habiles pour sauver Nidavellir, et comptez sur la Reine Dagfid qui a appelé à l’aide de braves mercenaires et leurs artefacts précieux.

Désormais, l’Elvaland avec la mise la plus haute pour la taverne en cours de résolution, peut, plutôt que de recruter une carte Nain·e ou une carte Offrande Royale dans la taverne, choisir d’aller dans le Camp pour y prendre un Artefact magique ou recruter une carte Mercenaire. En cas d’égalité pour déterminer le plus haute mise sur une taverne en cours, référez-vous aux valeurs des gemmes comme dans le jeu de base. Seul l’Elvaland qui a la plus grosse mise à peut se rendre au Camp et y prendre une carte. Les autres Elvalands doivent, dans l’ordre de résolution, prendre une carte dans la taverne en cours de résolution. Si l’Elvaland qui a joué en premier a choisi de prendre une carte dans le Camp, il faudra défausser la carte Nain·e restante de la taverne avant de passer à la Résolution de la taverne suivante. Le camp est constitué d’Artefacts et de Mercenaires.

Thingvellir, les atouts :

- Nouvelles cartes Héros.ïne, cartes Mercenaire avec deux classes et cartes Artefact aux pouvoirs uniques.
- Un système de coin building novateur.
- Stratégies nombreuses et variées.

Name: Sex Gedächtnisspiel
Description:
The Miko sex memory game is played just like the popular memory game. All cards are shuffled face down on the table. As many pairs as possible should be found. But beware! There are also 24 crazy tasks in this game. The tasks are divided into two halves, which in turn are on different cards. If you happened to turn the left and right halves of an order while playing this memory game, then you will have to complete this order on the spot, to the glee of all players.

—user summary

Name: Aqua Garden: Sea Jewelry Expansion
Description:
This expansion adds four different sea animals to the Aqua Garden base game: the scallop, the sea otter, the clione and the coelacanth.

Each creature will act as an advanced game piece that will score points in specific ways.

Name: Soirée Escape Game: Panique à Tchernobyl
Description:
A complete kit to organize an incredible escape game evening with friends, in one of the most oppressive worlds: the Chernobyl power station, in Ukraine, transformed into a death trap. 
An unprecedented catastrophe will shake your life when, following hazardous handling, Reactor No. 4 melts.

Try to escape, find iodine pills, the right combination, a vehicle and… get out of the disaster scene as soon as possible!

—description from the publisher

Name: Escape Game Spécial Famille: Attaque Viking au Puy du Fou
Description:
A complete kit to organize successful escape game parties with the family.

You have one hour to escape from the village you have just looted and which is surrounded by your enemies!


—description from the publisher

Contents:
- A booklet with indications on the scenario, reminders of the rules and answers to puzzles and other games.
- 72 puzzle cards
- 10 envelopes to hide in the room

Name: ATS Pork Chop Hill 2016
Description:
‘IRON TRIANGLE’ OUTPOST PORK CHOP HILL, KOREA 6 July 1953: At 1025 hours on the night of July 6th a massive artillery and mortar barrage preceded an onslaught by 700 soldiers from the CCF 200th Regiment, 67th Division. The sounds from the crashing shells concealed the oncoming Chinese, until they burst forward in what was described as “a moving carpet of yelling, howling men--whistles and bugles blowing, their officers screaming like women driving their men uphill.” In a bunker CP just beneath the crest of the hill Corporal Dale W. Cain heard his radio come alive with reports of “enemy in large numbers”. Company A reported hand-to-hand fighting in the trenches. The battle was fought in a driving monsoon rain, making evacuation of the wounded difficult, as well as re-supply. As the battle swayed back and forth, the Chinese made repeated pushes to take the hill while both sides unleashed a storm of artillery fire upon the struggling soldiers. During the course of two days, parts of four companies defended Pork Chop. At dawn on July 8th, the rain ended for a time and the initial defenders were withdrawn. The defenders counted nine enemy assaults during the night of July 6-7. By 11 July General Taylor reluctantly decided to abandon Pork Chop Hill. As had been the case on Old Baldy, Taylor could not justify risking more lives for a hill that was of minimal strategic significance. The armistice was finally just around the corner.

Newly remastered - really NEW as the terrain has changed in some instances, not to mention the retro art and then some > AND THE MAP IS about 120% ENLARGED! It makes for an amazing battlefield! You receive a 'lucky 7' set of scenarios that ALL play on the new map, covering a good 100+ hours plus of gaming.

Ownership of the ATS Rulebook 2014 and small + large system markers is required. ALL THE COMBAT COUNTERS NEEDED TO PLAY ARE INCLUDED.> is required.

Components:
4 mapsheets (18.5" x 12.5")
2 countersheets (identical, with TT-sized counters)
7 scenarios (4 sheets - 1 bonus scenario using the Toktong Ridge map is also included)
2 sheet (4 page) battlefield walkaround
1 ziploc insert (with LOS examples printed on the inside)

-description from publisher's website

Name: GPS: Expansion Pack
Description:
GPS: Expansion Pack adds components to play GPS with up to 7 players.  It also includes the Numberless Satellites Expansion and Speciality Satellites Expansion.

The Numberless Satellites expansion provides players with 3 additional satellites that are unnumbered.  When choosing to place a satellite at the location of the spinning rocket ship, an unnumbered satellite may be placed instead of the typical numbered satellites.  This increases the flexibility to arrange your satellites in a sequential orbit.

The Specialty Satellites expansion provides players with 3 additional satellites that break the standard rules and can interfere with your opponents' orbital plans.  Use them secretly and wisely to efficiently stake your place amongst the stars.

Additionally, this expansion pack increases the maximum player count to 7 which can be applied to the base game, the Numberless Satellites expansion, or the Specialty Satellites expansion.

This was packaged together along with two other expansion in 10-Minute Games: Expansions and currently not available by itself.

Name: Lockpick
Description:
Lockpick is a solo game in which the player attempts to work with randomly-drawn cards to create Rummy-style sets of three in various columns. The theme is one of breaking in to a security system via lockpicking and computer hacking. Designed for the Looney Pyramids family, Lockpick requires a Zark City deck (or other five-suited deck from with values from 1-13), 15 pyramids in five colors, and two dice: a standard D6 and a specialized color die.

In more detail, the card deck is separated into five piles by color with space left below each pile to form a column. Space for a discard pile goes off to the side. Each turn, the player begins with an empty hand and rolls the two dice. The numeral on the D6 determines how many cards the player must draw, and the color die determines what color pile the player must draw from. With these cards in hand, the player must now distribute them among the columns beneath the color piles, using a mancala-style distribution that wraps around and will cause newer cards to cascade down, partially covering previously-placed cards. Any three-card sets that are created within the columns are now removed along with the colored pyramid that sits above that column.

Once a color pile is depeleted, subsequent die rolls of that color allow the player to remove a matching color card from one of the columns and reposition it at the bottom of any column desired, thus allowing for the possibility of sets being created through the joining of two previously unconnected groups of cards within a single column, along with the rare opportunity for two sets to be formed at once. Victory is achieved when a player has successfully defeated all 15 security measures (represented by the 15 pyramids). Defeat occurs when all the cards have been depleted while there are pyramids still standing.

Name: Benidorm: The Game
Description:
Roll the dice to move around the board starting your life as a tourist, get a job maybe as a prop or become an extra on Benidorm and work your way up to being a TV celebrity. Make it through the holiday and you can start buying bars and restaurants building up to your own hotel chain. Will you end up living the dream or sleeping on the Levante beach.

Take a stroll around the market or maybe get lost in the old town, will you get scammed by the potato men or call house at bingo, spend all night singing karaoke or dancing on the square. Rent a mobility scooter speeding round the board or crash the hire car ending up in Levante Hospital. Avoid paying your taxes, get done by the sound police, lose your wallet skinny dipping in the sea, win big at the bookies, this game has it all. Win the game by becoming a Benidorm tycoon but just hope French air traffic control strikes don't hit your pocket

Only the brave live here and the lucky survive


     Over 100 life and risk cards bringing you the daily ups and downs of life in Benidorm



     All your favourite businesses, pay for food & drink to the property owner, collect rents off your friends



     Will you get a caravan, live in a villa by the sea, shop at the market or can you afford luxury items



     How will you play this game of skill & chance – fun for all the family


—description from the designer

Name: U.S.S. Sus
Description:
The survey ship U.S.S. Sus has just a few more tweaks, checks, and tests to undergo before it can begin its mission in deep space.  However, not everyone wants to see the ship succeed at exploring far planets.  Intruders have boarded the ship and are disguised as part of the astronaut crew.  Can the astronauts find the intruders  and expel them from the ship before it is too late?

U.S.S. Sus is a hidden role game where 5-11 players take on the roles of the astronauts or intruders and then try to figure out who they can trust and who is suspicious.

The game is played in rounds and each round has three phases.  In the first phase all players secretly choose a location in the ship to work in.  In the second phase players will find out who else is working in the same room, and then the intruder players can attempt to kill a player in the same or adjacent room.  In the final phase the players discuss who is an intruder and decide if someone is going out an airlock.

—description from the designer

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death – Alt Gender Hero Pack
Description:
In desperate times, there is a call for Heroes! A new group of Adventurers gear up and head into the mines and beyond, ready to fight back the darkness and save the day!

Every Hero Character Sheet in Shadows of Brimstone has a Male Portrait on one side and a Female Portrait on the other. This set contains the Miniatures for the Alternate Gender version of the Heroes tha come as part of the Swamps of Death Core Set. This set also includes all of the Cards, Counters, Character Sheets, and Upgrade Charts needed to use these as additional Heroes in your games of Shadows of Brimstone. Each hero in the alt gender set has their own rule sheet which includes any rules that are specific to that character.

Contents:
Rulesheet
1 x Female Indian Scout
1 x Male Rancher
1 x Female Lawman
1 x Nun (Female Preacher)
4 x 30mm Bases
4 x Large Hero Character Sheets
31 x Game Cards
4 x Hero Upgrade Charts
1 x Die-Cut Counter Sheet

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients – Alt Gender Hero Pack
Description:
In desperate times, there is a call for Heroes! A new group of Adventurers gear up and head into the mines and beyond, ready to fight back the darkness and save the day!

Every Hero Character Sheet in Shadows of Brimstone has a Male Portrait on one side and a Female Portrait on the other. This set contains the Miniatures for the Alternate Gender version of the Heroes that come as part of the City of the Ancients Core Set. This set also includes all of the Cards, Counters, Character Sheets, and Upgrade Charts needed to use these as additional Heroes in your games of Shadows of Brimstone. Each hero in the alt gender set has their own rule sheet which includes any rules that are specific to that character.

Contents:
Rulesheet
1 Female Gunslinger
1 Female U.S. Marshal
1 Female Bandida
1 Piano Player (Male Saloon Girl)
4 30 mm Bases
4 Large Hero Character Sheets (195×130 mm)
21 Game Cards (63.5×89 mm)
4 Hero Upgrade Charts
1 Die-Cut Counter Sheet

Name: Одесская Мафия (Odessa Mafia)
Description:
ÐžÐ´ÐµÑÑÐºÐ°Ñ Ð¼Ð°Ñ„Ð¸Ñ, Odessa Mafia

Odessa, pearl by the sea!  This beautiful and creative city is famous not only for its works of art, masterpieces of cinematography and pearls of humor, but also for the legends of the gangster world.  Become a member of the All-Union Bolshevik Party, up to 15 people can play.

Gameplay:
Before the start of the game, all its participants receive party tickets, which indicate their role for the current game. Looked at the ticket - close it immediately and do not tell anyone who you are.

The game consists of "Night" and "Day" phases. 
The mafia rampages at night, and during the day, civilians hunt down the Odessa bandits. 
Each of the players is obliged to nominate his own candidate on suspicion of involvement in gangster circles, you can vote once, you cannot abstain. The one who gets the most votes is eliminated from the game, but does not reveal his/her role.

Win conditions:
Civilians can win if they figure out the whole mafia, 
the mafia wins when its number equals the one of the law-abiding citizen.
Additional cards give a special charm to the game.

–User description

Name: Micronations
Description:
Players lead groups of kids in building micronations that will fight for economic and territorial supremacy of the neighborhood. The game takes place on a map made of hexagons. During the game players can have their kids build forts or work at headquarters to grow their economy and gain resources. Supply lines must be maintained to transfer this wealth. Each micronation can also print their own currency which they can use for trade or negotiations with other micronations. The value of this currency can be brought up or down for manipulative purposes. Other optional strategies involve combat or social infiltration to convert kids from other micronations. Aside from these challenges kids must avoid parents who randomly wander the map in attempts to make them go home. The player with the most stored resources at the end of the game is the winner.

—description from the designer

NOTE: The first edition of Micronations was named Neighborhood Conflict. It was known under that name in years 2011–2013.

     Not to be confused with first edition of Tactical Friction, which was also named Neighborhood Conflict, but got renamed to Tactical Friction in 2008.
     Not to be confused with Neighborhood Conflict.

Name: Magnetic Baseball Pocket Travel Game
Description: The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 20 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Magnetic American Football Pocket Travel Game
Description: The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 19 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Magnetic Volleyball Pocket Travel Game
Description: The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 24 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Cards Against IT: Series 3
Description:
Extra deck of cards for Cards Against IT with Security based cards.
Pomotion item from Varonis, an IT security company

Name: Magnetic Hideout Pocket Travel Game
Description: There is a starting space for each player. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach the hideout wins the game. Some spaces hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Magnetic Search Pocket Travel Game
Description: The players start at the starting space. The first to reach the space with the treasure trunk wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. If a player gets on an occupied space, the other player has to go back to the next car of his color. On the blue spaces the players may change direction.

Name: Magnetic Voyage Game Pocket Travel Game
Description:
The players start at the starting space. The first to reach the finish wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

Name: Theorem
Description:
In Theorem, players will be dealt 7 cards and attempt to get rid of their cards by playing them in sets. Players will follow their own rule cards, but can also use rules revealed by other players. When a player plays 7 cards, then they win!

—description from the publisher

Name: A Taste of Victory! Scenarios for 1676 to 1693 Beneath the Lily Banners
Description:
A 116 page book containing 18 scenarios for Beneath the Lily Banners. Each can be played on a table between 6 x 4 and 6 x 6 feet in size over 2-3 hours.

The period covered by these scenarios is 1676 to 1693.

The theatres are: Skane Wars, Great Turkish War, Morean War, Tangier, Sedgemoor Rebellion, Jacobite Wars in Ireland and Scotland, Nine Years War in Flanders, Rhineland, The Caribbean and North America.

Name: Punsanity: Food Fighters vs. Party Animals
Description:
Punsanity is a quick, fun, and easy to learn card game that is both silly and full of strategy.  Players take turns fighting each other and defending themselves until someone destroys his enemy's commander and wins the game. Each player's deck is made up of many cards. Some cards - called puns or inside jokes - have powerful, one time use effects (just like the look your friends get the first time you say a corny line). Others are fighters who act both as your offensive and defensive line. They are super important and can even be upgraded with items, a third type of card.

The game gets more and more intense each turn because the more turns that go by, the more resources that gather in your resource pile. The more resources that gather in your resource pile, the more cards that will be played, and the more cards that will be played, the more destruction that will occur. Finally, the more destruction that will occur, the sooner the game will end.

—description from the publisher

Name: Punsanity: Mech Dwellers vs. Battle Mages
Description:
Punsanity is a quick, fun, and easy to learn card game that is both silly and full of strategy.  Players take turns fighting each other and defending themselves until someone destroys his enemy's commander and wins the game. Each player's deck is made up of many cards. Some cards - called puns[ or inside jokes - have powerful, one time use effects (just like the look your friends get the first time you say a corny line). Others are fighters who act both as your offensive and defensive line. They are super important and can even be upgraded with items, a third type of card.

The game gets more and more intense each turn because the more turns that go by, the more resources that gather in your resource pile. The more resources that gather in your resource pile, the more cards that will be played, and the more cards that will be played, the more destruction that will occur. Finally, the more destruction that will occur, the sooner the game will end.

—description from the publisher

Name: De Bellis Renationis version 2.0
Description:
De Bellis Renationis is a set of wargames rules for Renaissance battles covering the period from 1494 AD to 1700 AD.
 DBR version 2.0 offers a combination of realism and excitement for this warfare using miniature figures in any scale from 30mm to 2mm. 
The creation of experienced wargame designers Phil Barker and Richard Bodley Scott, DBR can be used to refight historical engagements or your own scenarios from small scale skirmishes to the largest battles of the period. 
With its command system using "player initiative points", DBR emphasizes the player's generalship rather than his ability to manipulate a set of rules. It allows players to fight actions from the whole period and across the whole world, from Japan to Europe and the Americas and from the Italian Wars to the Nine Years War.

This edition combines the 2002 edition of the rules with all three of the books of Army Lists and includes everything the wargamer needs to refight these battles in one single convenient volume.

—description from the back of the book

Name: Pays de Redon et Vallons de Vilaine: le Jeu !
Description:
Pays de Redon et Vallons de Vilaine: le Jeu ! is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the territory of Redon, Allaire, Avessac, Bains-sur-Oust, Béganne ...

Name: Money Mad
Description:
There are cards in 4 suits in a different number and with different values. All players start with £30.
Each player has 3 cards on his hand and has 1 turn to exchange one of it by drawing one of the draw pile or the last discarded one of a specific suit. Then each player passes one card to his neighbor. All cards are revealed and compared. The player with the lowest score pays the difference to the highest score into the pot.  The player with the highest score takes the difference to the second highest score from the pot. Several rounds are played, eliminating all players who went broke. Last player in the game gets the whole pot and wins.
Mechanism, game weight and feeling is somewhat similar to Swim.
Released in a style like Cheapass Games, probably in the 70s.

Name: The Battle of Fismes: Disrupted River Crossing
Description:
After dispatching Blücher’s Army of Silesia at Vauchamps, Napoleon diverted temporarily toward the Seine at Montereau, for an inconclusive brush with Schwarzenberg’s Army of Bohemia. His inveterate foe Blücher apparently had learned no lessons and threatened to move again on Paris. By March 3rd Napoleon was returning northward along the bank of the Ourcq River. The fall of Soissons, cheaply surrendered by General Moreau, saw the quarry escape over the Aisne River to link-up with 43,000 reinforcements near Laon, raising his strength to over 100,000.

Fismes is a hypothetical engagement simulating a possible battle at this river Crossing on March 4th 1814.
Families: Series: The Library of Napoleonic Battles (OSG)

Name: Garden Rush
Description:
Garden Rush is a tile-placement battle game in a vegetable garden, all contained in a playable compact box — a two-player game in which players race to grow vegetables in their garden and fill their basket before their neighbor.

Careful planning is needed to plant each vegetable in its unique pattern for future harvesting, while keeping an eye on the conveyor belt shared between the gardens.

Name: Aqua Garden: Sea King Expansion
Description:
This expansion adds several different sea animals to the Aqua Garden base game: the oarfish, the giant squid, the sea urchin and the blue tang.

Each creature will act as an advanced game piece that will score points in specific ways.

Name: Standing Stones
Description:
The first game in a new series: Roll and Write Revolution!

Roll and write style game that uses Dominoes as the randomizer instead of dice. Each turn, players are blind bidding for cards which earn them bonus effects or goods then using the other half of the domino as a worker placement mechanism. Players will also be able to assign their Worker to another player's sheet to activate a resource conversion ability.

Thematically, the players are creating a Pictish village in the Scottish Iron Age. Their activities include farming, hunting, crafting, art, and piracy against the Roman Empire.

After 3 rounds of 7 turns each the game ends and the player who has earned the most Prestige for their village is the winner!

—description from the publisher

Name: This is America
Description:
A fantastic and dynamic board game about our great country's history and culture: the objective of the game is to conquer the White House and become President of the United States of America.

The game's objective consists of one of the players becoming the President of the United States of America. Our game is not as challenging to achieve this as in real life. To win this game, you need to know a variety of information about this country. Therefore, to become the President, you must conquer the states on the map. How do you win a state? Well, simply answering the questions correctly!

Each State Card has a number. This signifies the number of questions that need to be answered to win that state. who can win the states by answering either 2,3,4 or 5 questions; this depends on each state's size and population. Similar to what happens in the electoral college).

Next, the player will spin the roulette wheel, and the arrow will indicate the category of the first question to answer. Another player will take the question and read it out loud. If the player who answers the questions gives the correct response, then they will continue answering questions.

When the necessary questions to win the state are all answered, the state will have been conquered. The player will take one of their chips and will place it in the corresponding state on the board.

In order to win, you must be the first player to conquer 8 States. All the pieces of the white house have been turned over, and you'll be the President of the United States of America.

—description from the designer

Name: Pays de Vannes-Auray: le Jeu !
Description:
Pays de Vannes-Auray: le Jeu ! is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 1000 questions, written questions and photos with also charades and riddles as well as "junior" questions. 
Subjects covered as are as varied as history or geography going from Saint-Dolay to Camors, Belle-Ile, Carnac, Étel or Pleucadeuc, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the territory of Vannes...

Content:

     game board,
     6 pawns,
     1 dice,
     650 "adult" questions,
     100 "junior" questions,
     140 visual questions

Name: Escape Room: The Game 3
Description:
This follow-up to Escape Room: The Game contains three new escape rooms:
Panic on the Titanic, Dawn of the Zombies, and Alice in Wonderland

Note that the UK release is titled Escape Room: The Game 2 while the US release is Escape Room: The Game 3.

Other language versions of this edition have a different set of escape rooms, and have separate BGG entries:

     Escape Room: The Game 2 (several languages) Panic on the Titanic + Dawn of the Zombies + Alice in Wonderland + Another Dimension
     Escape Room: Das Spiel 2 (German): Alice in Wonderland + Another Dimension + Wild West Express + The Break-In
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: Los Sitios de Zaragoza
Description:
This strategy game from los sitios was published it in 1990 by the now defunct Ya newspaper.

The French player must destroy 2/3 of the pieces of the Spanish player or starve the defenders of Zaragoza. 
The latter is achieved by keeping the city with its defenders completely under siege for five consecutive turns. 
The Spanish win if they avoid the French player to win.

The city is completely besieged by the French when its counters completely surround the perimeter with their squares of influence for a full turn.

The game is played in 16 turns.

A turn consists of alternate movement and combat of the two sides. 
The French player begins.

Name: オフトゥンからの脱出: 拡張01 猫のいる生活 (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu: Exp 01 Neko no iru Seikatsu)
Description:
ã‚ªãƒ•ãƒˆã‚¥ãƒ³ã‹ã‚‰ã®è„±å‡º: æ‹¡å¼µ01 çŒ«ã®ã„ã‚‹ç”Ÿæ´» (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu: Exp 01 Neko no iru Seikatsu) is the first expansion set for ã‚ªãƒ•ãƒˆã‚¥ãƒ³ã‹ã‚‰ã®è„±å‡º (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu). This expansion (Life With A Cat) adds 20 new lesson cards and extends the round to 8 rounds instead of 4.

The students have passed their exams and enter a new year of school. Things are going okay, but the midterm exam is looming. And now, a new friend enters their life...

When the players begin the game, they use the sides of the futon cards without a cat, and then flip it when they acquire their first cat. The more cats they have, the more points they can score in the game.
user summary

Name: Liquid Squid
Description:
In 2088 only monolithic cities of trans-humanistic worship protrude from the crust of the earth. Between these cities lies The Expanse, where all opposed were banished. The first to stabilize an economy was Neo Tokyo. The 3 foundational levels that stabilized the economy are as follows:

THE UNDERBELLY
The Underbelly is at street level and is home to the augmentation junkies looking to merge with machines as much and as fast as possible. This is a wild jungle with extremes in morals and values. The Underbelly is a powerful economy completely driven by tech advances.

THE PEN
The Pen, home to the sheeple. The Pen is completely self contained ecosystem above the Underbelly. It is a stable economy but possesses a docile culture which needs protection provided by corporate security called "The Regulators". Now that The Pen faces a new threat from the villains henchmen, their fear needs to be managed because if the The Pen falls, so does the city.

THE QUANTUM
Above it all sits The Quantum, the home of the Corporate Elite. Completely sealed off and secured, these are the lever pullers. Their key to success was helping to facilitate a social contract with the citizens and their representatives. This unwritten understanding is what made Neo Tokyo possible and has yet to be displayed, defined or quantified.

When word got around about the quality of Aug's/Mods and the success rate, many, including Natalia Burtolla (an accomplished hacker known as Liquid Squid) rushed to Neo Tokyo. Born without legs, she came for the best money could buy.  She quickly fell in love with the city and the feeling was mutual. She finally feels at home and will do anything to protect Neo Tokyo.

With great decadents comes greater corruption and the stench of that sludge attracts the greatest of villains.

When the villains henchmen hit the streets many were caught off guard. Liquid Squid was well aware and prepared for this threat. To The Underbelly, this was only a matter of time.

OBJECTIVE
A Super Villain is hell bent on terrorizing Neo Tokyo into his control. If he takes out 3 Landmarks he gains the levers of power over the entire city. When the 3rd Landmark has been targeted for attack the Super Villain himself and his elite army descend to make sure the job gets done right. Try to foil the attacks on Landmarks until you can assemble an army of allies powerful enough to defeat him and end the chaos.

DEFEND NEO TOKYO
Neo Tokyo is rife with the Villains Henchmen and natural enemy factions that will destroy anyone and anything in their path. You must protect the citizens from these threats. At the same time you must try to foil attacks on Landmarks until you are prepared to face the Super Villain.

BUILD AN ARMY
Build rep with powerful city influencers by completing missions, assemble your army of allies and temper public fear.

END THE CHAOS
When the third Landmark is triggered you go toe-to-toe with the Super Villain and his army with only one option for an ending. Explosive.

THE STREETS
The streets are the underbelly of Neo Tokyo and have 3 stand-alone districts which hold 36 key locations. The Villains henchmen are causing chaos across the city. It has become a monstrous jungle war between the treacherous and the savage. The Villain needs to destroy three landmarks to throw the city into proper chaos and take control of the primary levers.  You must defend the streets while building an ally army and when you’re ready, end the chaos.

PUBLIC FEAR
During play the Villain will trigger events that spook the general public. The higher the Public Fear meter rises the more carnage the Villain will rain down on the city. Gain reputation with influencers and they will use their platforms to try and calm the public.

MISSIONS
There are 126 missions offering reputation and gadget rewards. When visiting locations around the city you can access Mission Control to see what missions are available and select at least one.

ENEMY AND ALLY POOLS
The enemy pool builds randomly during play, these forces are inserted into a scenario when they are triggered. A Landmark is triggered when 3 enemies appear on it. You build the ally pool and those are the forces you use when a Landmark is triggered.

LANDMARKS
There are 12 Landmarks across the city. Each has a unique one-shot combat scenario. When a Landmark is triggered place the scenario on the board, try to defuse the situation and exit with as much loot as possible. If an ally does not reach an exit they are removed from your forces.

POINTS of INTEREST (POI)
In order to hack from the streets Liquid Squid must enter a POI. POI's can be destroyed as well but do not count as Landmarks. Most missions involve POI locations and NPC's from those locations.

HACKING
HACK INTO THE ENVIRONMENT AND ENEMIES
Liquid Squid is a balanced dance between physical combat and hacking. If you have an angry mob on the other side of the city, not a problem. Hack in and set-off a Regulator Alarm, that will make ‘em scatter. Facing an overpowered enemy? No problem. Hack into his system, overload it and watch the fire works. The synergy between problem solving, physical combat and hacking is what makes Liquid Squid so enjoyable.

In order to hack there has to be a Mobile Hub in the district. You will always have a 50% chance that there is a Mobile Hub in the district. But you can gain control of Mobile Hubs and dedicate them to certain districts granting 100% hacking as long as you maintain control of the Mobile Hub.
In order to hack the streets, Liquid Squid must launch the hack from a Point of Interest. In a scenario she must launch a hack from a Hack Entry Point. Hacking consists of O-Hack/D-Hack gadgets, Offensive/Defensive Programs (Oprog/Dprog) and NODES.

FACTIONS
The Syndicate (Ally)
The Syndicate are a network of gangs in the Tokyo Underbelly lead by Robert Crisp. Attain Ally status with Crisp and they will join you in your fight.

Regulators (Ally)
The Regulators are corporate security and the law in Neo Tokyo. Attain Ally Status with Chief Yamasaki and they will join you in battle.

The Coda (Enemy)
The Coda are the Villains henchmen. They are a mixed bag of characters with a wide range of mod limits. They are exceedingly loyal to their boss, relentless terrorists and your sworn enemy.

Outliers (Enemy)
Outliers are the Villains Praetorian Guard. They have taken exceptionally well to merging with machines and poses a fervor to watch the world burn.

Mercs (Ally)
Mercs are deadly mercenaries for hire. They have a natural disdain for oppressors and Outliers in particular. Mercs further modify their Mods for optimum carnage. Mercs will join Liquid Squid free of charge.

Drones (Enemy)
These nasty machines are the Super Villains master assassins. They have destroyed the competition, even Regulator Drones. Now they only exist to hunt you and your ilk.

Block Rockers (Enemy)
Block Rockers are massive mechs with on board sentient AI. They will cut off passage through the block and are chock full of Gank Rating. Each of the three types of Block Rocker requires a specific gadget to engage them.

The Chimera (Enemy)
The Chimera are mutants who suffered grotesque side effects from merging with machines. Chimera can be found in the Underbelly and below. Besides general carnage they also maintain coordinated attacks of "The Pen" above.

—description from the publisher
